Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, to demonstrate understanding of diverse environments.
The student can include various living things such as plants and animals in each habitat drawing to show variety.
The student can draw specific examples of living things in land habitats like forests or gardens, such as trees, squirrels, and flowers, to illustrate biodiversity.
The student can draw specific examples of living things in water habitats like ponds or streams, such as fish, clams, and aquatic plants, to illustrate biodiversity.
The student can depict patterns in the types of living things found in each habitat to highlight the diversity and uniqueness of each environment.
